akas: Second to Last Love World-wide (English title)
The Second Last Love World-wide (English title) (alternative title)
My Second Last Love World-wide (English title) (alternative title)
akas from release info: Second to Last Love World-wide (English title)
The Second Last Love World-wide (English title) (alternative title)
My Second Last Love World-wide (English title) (alternative title)

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Two aging workaholics, Kang Min Joo, a drama producer, and Go Sang Sik, a government official repeatedly butt heads, until an accident drives them together.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: After the bungee jump accident, there are even more conflicts between Min Joo and Sang Sik. When Min Joo moves to the country, she mets a handsome neighbor, who turns out to be related to Sang Sik!

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Min Joo tries to resolve her company's plagiarism accusation, and Sang Sik is forced to work with an old rival and a coworker with a crush. Sang Sik's family keeps meddling in Min Joo's affairs.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Sang Sik and run into each other at a concert, then meet up for a drink to commiserate about aging and their jobs. Joon Woo tries to get closer to Min Joo, only to called away from someone sending mysterious text messages.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: The sudden downpour wasn't the only thing to go sour at the grape festival - an advertised drama idol didn't show up and vendors didn't sell enough product. It's up to Sang Sik and Min Joo to attend to these issues.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Min Joo searches for a new drama for her company, but finds herself on bad terms with writers and actors. She also finds her yard invaded by Sang Sik's relatives. Joon Woo's admirer continues to show up at the worst times.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Sang Sik agrees to let Mi Rae work on Min Joo's drama, but upsetting revelations about the past interfere with her performance on the job.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Min Joo and Sang Sik go in and out of hazy memories of their drunken kisses, subduing their emotions for one another. Sang Sik is rattled when he sees Ye Ji on a date.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Sang Sik and Min Joo might have something everlastingly important connecting them. Chun Soo forgets his and Sang Hee's wedding anniversary, and tries to go on a date instead.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Min Joo and Joon Woo start "dating" but the level of attraction is unbalanced. Sang Sik is tormented by memories of Min Joo's fiance's death.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: Joon Woo confronts Sang Sik, and Min Joo breaks it off with him. Though Min Joo and Sang Sik aren't dating, they do go out together very often. Eun Ho's mother enlists Min Joo to find out the truth about her son's death.

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: Sang Sik works up the courage to tell Min Joo about what happened the day of her fiance's death. The results of the Woori City drama come in, and drive Jung Sik to spread false rumors about Sang Sik.

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: Sang Sik uncovers the corruption that preventing Min Joo from winning the drama competition. Min Joo learns the fate of Sang Sik's wife.

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: Min Joo moves out, upsetting Sang Sik and his family, but he's too stubborn to do anything about it.

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot: Min Joo and Sang Sik run into each other and address their missed connections. Will an act of sabotage and a natural disaster bring them together or drive them further apart?

16.title: Episode #1.16
16.plot: Han See confronts Chan Soo about his affair. Min Joo moves back, but their relationship might ruin Sang Sik's career.

17.title: Episode #1.17
17.plot: After being accused of corruption, Sang Sik and Min Joo work to uncover the truth and clear his name. Joon Woo finally realizes Mi Rae's feelings for him.

18.title: Episode #1.18
18.plot: Mi Rae and Joon Woo attempt to go on their first date, while Sang Sik faces identity theft, a missing daughter, and a rival who will stop at nothing to ruin him.

19.title: Episode #1.19
19.plot: Joon Woo gets a job offer in Canada, where will this leave Mi Rae? After a devastating fire, Sang Sik and Min Joo are in comas, who will seek justice on their behalf?

20.title: Episode #1.20
20.plot: In the final episode, Sang Sik and Min Joo want to be together, but can't decide how to proceed in their relationship.

imdb.plot outline: Kang Min Joo (Kim Hee Ae) is a pragmatic, single, 40-something television producer who has no time for love and pretends she doesn't want any either. Deep down, though, she does wish something would happen in her love life. As fate would have it, she meets Go Sang Sik (Ji Jin Hee), an environmental facility section chief at city hall who sincerely believes he does not need any romance in his life. But when the two meet, love finds its way into their lives. Now, in a revival of the kind of romance they both left behind years ago, Kang Min Joo and Go Sang Sik will have to learn that no matter how much they try to deny it, the heart wants what the heart wants. Adding to the drama are Go Mi Ryeo (Oh My Ghostess star Kim Seul Gi), a webtoon writer and Sang Sik's little sister, and Min Ji Sun (Detectives of Seonam Girls' High School alum Stephanie Lee), a family friend's old flame who will form a love triangle with the two hesitant romantics. An official remake of the 2012 hit Japanese drama of the same name, Second to Last Love comes from director Choi Young Hoon, who has come a long way since his days as an assistant director on The Painter of the Wind. Screenwriter Choi Yoon Jung, whose daunting resume includes hits such as Mr. Baek, Emergency Couple and Lie to Me, pens the adaptation, once again channeling her nuanced understanding of what happens when you find romance where you least expect it. The first episode of Second to Last Love will air on SBS on July 30, 2016, with subsequent episodes airing every Saturday and Sunday at 10:00PM, in the time slot vacated by the conclusion of Beautiful Gong Shim. The drama is expected to run for 20 episodes, with an expected finale some time in September 2016. The full cast for Second to Last Love includes Ji Jin Hee as Go Sang Sik, Kim Hee Ae as Kang Min Joo, Kim Seul Gi as Go Mi Ryeo, Stephanie Lee as Min Ji Sun, Lee Soo Min as Go Ye Ji, and Kim Kwon as Cha Soo Hyuk.
imdb.title: Second to Last Love
plot: Kang Min Joo (Kim Hee Ae) is a pragmatic, single, 40-something television producer who has no time for love and pretends she doesn't want any either. Deep down, though, she does wish something would happen in her love life. As fate would have it, she meets Go Sang Sik (Ji Jin Hee), an environmental facility section chief at city hall who sincerely believes he does not need any romance in his life. But when the two meet, love finds its way into their lives. Now, in a revival of the kind of romance they both left behind years ago, Kang Min Joo and Go Sang Sik will have to learn that no matter how much they try to deny it, the heart wants what the heart wants. Adding to the drama are Go Mi Ryeo (Oh My Ghostess star Kim Seul Gi), a webtoon writer and Sang Sik's little sister, and Min Ji Sun (Detectives of Seonam Girls' High School alum Stephanie Lee), a family friend's old flame who will form a love triangle with the two hesitant romantics. An official remake of the 2012 hit Japanese drama of the same name, _Second to Last Love_ (qv) comes from director Choi Young Hoon, who has come a long way since his days as an assistant director on The Painter of the Wind. Screenwriter Choi Yoon Jung, whose daunting resume includes hits such as Mr. Baek, Emergency Couple and Lie to Me, pens the adaptation, once again channeling her nuanced understanding of what happens when you find romance where you least expect it. The first episode of _Second to Last Love_ (qv) will air on SBS on July 30, 2016, with subsequent episodes airing every Saturday and Sunday at 10:00PM, in the time slot vacated by the conclusion of Beautiful Gong Shim. The drama is expected to run for 20 episodes, with an expected finale some time in September 2016. The full cast for _Second to Last Love_ (qv) includes Ji Jin Hee as Go Sang Sik, Kim Hee Ae as Kang Min Joo, Kim Seul Gi as Go Mi Ryeo, Stephanie Lee as Min Ji Sun, Lee Soo Min as Go Ye Ji, and Kim Kwon as Cha Soo Hyuk.
